ATTR_DESC_ATK_Dark.ContentEN: When triggering bonus effects, inflicts a stack that deals periodic Umbra DMG to the target for 6s, up to 6 stacks, and reduces the target's Movement Speed, ATK Speed and Stance recovery speed.

ATTR_DESC_ATK_Fire.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effect: Pyro, inflicts a stack that deals periodic Pyro DMG to the target for 6s, up to 6 stacks.

ATTR_DESC_ATK_Light.ContentEN: When triggering bonus effects, inflicts a stack that deals periodic Lumino DMG to the target for 6s, up to 6 stacks, and refreshes the remaining duration of all bonus effects.

ATTR_DESC_ATK_Slash.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effect: Slash, doubles the Slash Damage dealt to the target's Shield.

ATTR_DESC_ATK_Smash.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effect: Smash, doubles the reduction to the target's Stance.

ATTR_DESC_ATK_Spike.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effect: Spike, doubles the Spike Damage dealt to the target's HP.

ATTR_DESC_ATK_Thunder.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effect: Electro, inflicts a stack that deals periodic Electro DMG to the target for 6s, up to 6 stacks.

ATTR_DESC_ATK_Water.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effect: Hydro, inflicts a stack that deals periodic Hydro DMG to the target for 6s, up to 6 stacks.

ATTR_DESC_ATK_Wind.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effect: Anemo, inflicts a stack that deals periodic Anemo DMG to the target for 6s, up to 6 stacks.

ATTR_DESC_BulletConver.ContentEN: The rate of ammo gained from the \

ATTR_DESC_CRI.ContentEN: When CRIT Chance exceeds 100%, it increases the CRIT Level, dealing higher CRIT Damage.

ATTR_DESC_EnmityValue.ContentEN: The lower the HP, the higher the damage dealt.

ATTR_DESC_ExcelWeaponTag.ContentEN: Attack increases when equipped with a corresponding weapon.

ATTR_DESC_MultiShoot.ContentEN: The chance of firing 1 additional projectile when shooting, which does not consume ammo. When it exceeds 100%, there is a chance to fire more than 1 additional projectile.

ATTR_DESC_SkillEfficiency.ContentEN: Affects the Sanity Cost of a skill.

ATTR_DESC_SkillIntensity.ContentEN: Affects Skill Damage and the effect magnitude of buffs/debuffs.

ATTR_DESC_SkillRange.ContentEN: Affects the range of Skill Effects.

ATTR_DESC_SkillSustain.ContentEN: Affects the duration of Skill Effects.

ATTR_DESC_StrongValue.ContentEN: The higher the HP, the higher the damage dealt.

ATTR_DESC_TriggerProbability.ContentEN: The chance of triggering Bonus Effects upon a single hit. Once triggered, if the attack deals multiple types of damage, all relevant Bonus Effects will take effect at once.

Attr_OnceDamagedPercent_Name.ContentEN: Max damage taken per hit (% of Max HP)

Attr_ReloadBulletNoLoss_Name.ContentEN: Chance to reload without consuming Ammo

BATTLE_RECOVERY_TEAMMATEBEINGHELP.ContentEN: <Highlight>%s</> is being revived by an ally

CAPTURE_BULLETJUMP_PC.ContentEN: Use Helix Leap (&Slide& + &Jump&) to catch up with the target faster

CAPTURE_BULLETJUMP_PHONE.ContentEN: Use Helix Leap (hold the button + swipe up and right) to catch up with the target faster

Content_110101_1.ContentEN: A voice seems to beckon from beyond...

Content_110101_2.ContentEN:
Do not let it ensnare you. Press forward and escape the nightmare.\
(If you exit now, you can re-enter Chapter Twilight from Sanctuary.)

Content_110102_1.ContentEN: You wake up from the nightmare, facing the razor-sharp fangs of Filthoids.

Content_110102_2.ContentEN:
Your squad has been ambushed by fierce Filthoids. Defeat them and reunite with your squad.\
(If you exit now, you can re-enter Chapter Twilight from Sanctuary.)

Content_110103_1.ContentEN:
After neutralising the sudden Filthoid threat, head to the emergency aid station to regroup with your squad.\
(If you exit now, you can re-enter Chapter Twilight from Sanctuary.)

Content_110103_2.ContentEN:
The battle has taken a heavy toll on your squad. Medic Daphne has asked for your help in comforting the wounded.\
Meanwhile, she plans to retrieve medical supplies from the warehouse. For safety reasons, you decide to go in her stead.

Content_110103_3.ContentEN: A sudden surge of Filthoids is approaching from the corridor, but the wounded are in no shape to fight. As the squad leader and the last man standing, you must hold the line and protect your comrades.

Content_110103_3_2.ContentEN: Avar's timely arrival has turned the tide of battle. Seize this moment to defeat the Filthoid leader and bring the fight to an end!

Content_110103_4.ContentEN: Together with Avar, you've successfully repelled the Filthoids. Time to return to the medical post to discuss the next move.

Content_110104_1.ContentEN: Avar instructs Daphne and the wounded to stay at the post and wait for reinforcements. Meanwhile, you and Avar press on into the heart of the Fortress to continue the mission.

Content_110104_2.ContentEN:
Assessing the situation, Avar believes The Forsakens anticipated the Empire's operation plans, putting you at a strategic disadvantage.\
To shift the odds, he decides to sabotage the Phoxichor tank in the engine room to disable the Fortress's defences, making it easier for your trapped comrades.

Content_110104_3.ContentEN:
Assessing the situation, Avar believes The Forsakens anticipated the Empire's operation plans, putting you at a strategic disadvantage.\
To shift the odds, he decides to sabotage the Phoxichor tank in the engine room to disable the Fortress's defences, making it easier for your trapped comrades.

Content_110105_1.ContentEN:
You encounter two members of Squad Snow Wolves. However, one of them is trapped in the heart of the engine room.\
Work with Avar to cut off the power and rescue your trapped comrade.

Content_110105_2.ContentEN: You've successfully reached the Engine Room. Time to cut the power.

Content_110106_1.ContentEN:
Though Vic has fallen, you must continue the mission.\
Work with Avar to disable the mechanisms in the engine room and stay alert for lurking Filthoids.

Content_110106_2.ContentEN: You've successfully disabled the power source, but in doing so, the self-destruct sequence of the Phoxichor tank has been activated. Escape the engine room before the countdown reaches zero.

Content_110106_3.ContentEN: Though Fulvis, the chief commander, insists on continuing the mission, Avar's judgment proves sound. Instead of a reckless attack that might cost you your lives, you focus on rescuing the Griffins first.

Content_110106_4.ContentEN: You encounter Simon, who is besieged by Filthoids. Take them down.

Content_110106_5.ContentEN: You've found Simon, but he's surrounded by Filthoids, and his condition looks dire.

Content_110107_1.ContentEN:
Though you were too late to save Simon, his final words reveal more comrades trapped near the rail tracks.\
Press forward to rescue those you still can.

Content_110107_2.ContentEN: You run into Filthoids along the way. Take them down quickly — don't let them slow you down.

Content_110107_3.ContentEN: A brief call with Daphne gives you a moment of reassurance. Keep moving forward.

Content_110108_1.ContentEN: A brief call with Daphne gives you a moment of reassurance. Keep moving forward.

Content_110108_2.ContentEN: You hear your squadmates calling out, but Filthoids block your path. Defeat them and regroup with your squad.

Content_110108_3.ContentEN: You've dealt with the Filthoids. Time to join your squad.

Content_110108_4.ContentEN: Your team came across two Charons. The young woman explained they were innocent townsfolk enslaved by The Forsakens. Unable to verify their identities, you decided to cautiously move forward in the direction the elder indicated, hoping to reunite with Avar.

Content_110109_1.ContentEN: Avar plans to blow open the door to the central control room with the turret.

Content_110109_2.ContentEN: The turret is moving along the track. Protect it from incoming Filthoids with Avar until it reaches its destination.

Content_110109_2_1.ContentEN: To blast open the central control room gate, you need to reposition the turret. Activate the control mechanism to move it along the track.

Content_110110_1.ContentEN: Use the turret to blast open the passage to the central control room.

Content_110110_2.ContentEN: After the bombardment, the side door to the central control room is open. Investigate the area with Avar.

Content_110110_3.ContentEN:
Katya suddenly launched an attack against you, but Avar reacted quickly and thwarted her plan.\
Discuss the current situation with Avar.

Content_110110_4.ContentEN:
You stopped to rest. While Avar recuperates, interrogate Katya to discover her motives for trying to assassinate you.\
Also, it seems Avar lost a photograph during the fight — perhaps you can help him find it.

Content_110110_5.ContentEN:
Katya isn't willing to tell the truth, obviously trying to provoke you. Her insolence brings back that familiar voice in your mind. You manage to keep your senses.\
Now, speak with Avar to plan your next move.

Content_110110_6.ContentEN: Avar initially plans to head to the central control room alone, but the fellow soldiers don't want to leave him to face the danger by himself. After some persuasion, Avar agrees to move forward with the group.

Content_110110_7.ContentEN: On your way to the central control room, you come across a strong Filthoid known as the Battle Maven. Trusting in Avar, your mentor and comrade, you're confident that together, you'll defeat this formidable foe.

Content_110110_8.ContentEN: You've defeated the formidable Filthoid. Keep moving forward.

Content_110111_1.ContentEN:
Upon reaching the central control room, you find it unexpectedly empty — no sign of the enemy or traps.\
Investigate the surroundings and search for clues.

Content_110111_2.ContentEN: Avar suddenly aims his gun at you.

Content_110111_3.ContentEN:
After coming to, you realise you're still alive. Survey your surroundings and assess your current situation.\
(If you exit now, you can re-enter Chapter Twilight from Sanctuary.)

Content_110111_4.ContentEN:
Avar shows no signs of life.\
Through the broadcast, you hear that the Legion has issued a warrant for Daphne, accusing her of espionage — a charge you know to be false. You must escape the central control room and find her as quickly as possible.

Content_110111_5.ContentEN: You find Daphne, though for some reason, she's aiming a gun at you.

Content_110111_6.ContentEN:
You've found Daphne. Despite her panic, she does her best to stay calm and fulfil her duties as a medic.\
The Fortress is no longer safe. Escape with her through the sewers.

Content_110112_1.ContentEN: The sewer's complex layout demands careful navigation. Proceed cautiously and find an escape route.

Content_110112_2.ContentEN: The enemy is trying to flood the sewers to prevent your escape. Activate the drainage system and continue your search for an exit.

Content_110113_1.ContentEN:
You and Daphne, hoping for a chance at survival, managed to find Chief Sibylle within Lonza Fortress. Soon after, you are taken to the Royal Military Prison for interrogation as suspects of espionage.\
To protect yourself and Daphne, and to honour Avar's sacrifice for justice, you must prove the truth to the Warden.

Content_110113_2.ContentEN:
The Warden administers a hypnotic drug to you. After a moment of dizziness, you find yourself in a bizarre space resembling Lonza Fortress.\
It seems you're about to endure a special \

Content_110113_3.ContentEN:
Endure the Warden's fiery trial to prove your innocence.\
(If you exit now, you can re-enter Chapter Twilight from Sanctuary.)

Content_110113_4.ContentEN:
You explain to the Warden what truly happened in the central control room — Avar faked his betrayal to secure vital evidence, sacrificing his life to leave behind a recording. Unfortunately, Fulvis's adjutant, Falsi, took the recording.\
After hearing your testimony, the Warden agrees to further investigate the case.

Content_200101_1.ContentEN: There's a familiar figure reminiscent of Snow outside Sanctuary.

Content_200101_2.ContentEN: Someone greeted you from behind. Check out who it is.

Content_200101_3.ContentEN:
The one who just stopped you introduced herself as a blacksmith of the Lunarians.\
According to Snow, she's an elder, though all Lunarians, irrespective of age, share a similar appearance and stature.\
In exchange for her forging expertise, Lunosmith hopes to join you on your journey.\
Take her back to Sanctuary.

Content_200101_4.ContentEN:
Lunosmith prides herself on her forging skills.\
Time to put her talents to the test.

Content_200102_1.ContentEN: Go to Hypnos' House to check on Psyche as you promised.

Content_200102_2.ContentEN:
The flowers Psyche has tenderly cared for are wilting, seemingly starved of nutrients.\
To revive them, special soil from a cave outside Icelake is needed — a simple task for a Phoxhunter.

Content_200102_3.ContentEN:
According to Psyche, this special soil can be found in a cave near Lamenting Lake.\
Go collect the right kind of soil for her.

Content_200102_4.ContentEN: The soil at the entrance of the cave is too dry for cultivating flowers. Venture deeper to find suitable soil.

Content_200102_5.ContentEN:
It's been a challenge, but you've finally found soft, suitable soil deep in the cave.\
Bring the soil back to Hypnos' House. Psyche is sure to be overjoyed.

Content_200201_1.ContentEN:
Sally is a warm-hearted elderly woman living by the side gate of Icelake. You can always smell the inviting scent of cream of mushroom soup near her.\
However, she's seemed rather preoccupied lately. Perhaps it's a good time for a comforting chat.

Content_200201_2.ContentEN: Ms Sally seems to be worrying about a lady she cares for. If you encounter this lady, you can perhaps help her out.

Content_200201_3.ContentEN: Lady Hilin has spent years waiting for a Charon man named Hamel Dickinson. She looks very distressed. Help Lady Hilin find some clues about Hamel Dickinson.

Content_200201_4.ContentEN: Venture into the depths of the pit to find clues regarding Hamel Dickinson's whereabouts.

Content_200201_5.ContentEN:
In the pit's depths, you discovered an old journal with Hamel Dickinson's name on the title page.\
It seems to chronicle events related to him. Return to Icelake and deliver it to Lady Hilin.

Content_200201_6.ContentEN:
After perusing the journal, Lady Hilin requested some time alone.\
Return to her maid Sally to collect your reward and learn about the whole story.

Content_200202_1.ContentEN: A man near the city gates is yelling, who seems to be selling something.

Content_200202_2.ContentEN: Claiming to be the King of Scavengers in Icelake, Martin gave you some lost items, and he wants you to find their owners.

Content_200202_3.ContentEN:
Paper stars made with expired train tickets... Maybe the ticket seller is the owner.\
However, she looks quite... \

Content_200203_1.ContentEN: The lady, with a hoarse voice and dirty dressy clothes, stopped passers-by over and over again, as if she were trying to find something...

Content_200203_2.ContentEN:
Ms Elsa's only daughter, Annie, went missing.\
Keep an eye out for anyone who might be Annie when you're in Icelake.

Content_200203_3.ContentEN:
A few Filthoids are wandering outside the city, and their boss seems to have clutched something in its jaws...\
Defeat the Filthoids to check out what it is.

Content_200203_3_2.ContentEN:
Turns out it was a notebook in the Filthoid's jaws.\
Pick it up and check out what it says.

Content_200203_4.ContentEN:
...Annie has tragically passed away, while the other girl, Alice, who ended up with Annie's clothes, has survived. \
Although Alice made it through the ordeal in the snowy mountains, the severe fevers she suffered afterwards took away her memories.\
Now that the truth is revealed, the next thing to do is explain everything to everyone.

Content_200203_5.ContentEN:
Alice remembered everything.\
Now we should go tell Ms Elsa about Anne's death...

Content_200204_1.ContentEN: You have received an invitation from Wells. He wants you to meet him at the The Asphodel.

Content_200204_2.ContentEN: Wells thinks you're capable, and he wants to complete a commission with you.

Content_200204_3.ContentEN:
You agreed to work with Wells on the commission.\
Get ready and go with him.

Content_200204_4.ContentEN:
Wells seems to be in trouble...\
Do something to get him out of his father-in-law's wrath.

Content_200205_1.ContentEN:
A man named Brunetto stares intently at you.\
He seems to have something to say.

Content_200205_2.ContentEN:
Brunetto also came from Purgatorio Island.\
He misses his hometown very much. If you could make it back to Purgatorio Island one day, he'd like you to see if there's anything left in his old house.

Content_200205_3.ContentEN: Brunetto's old house lies in the east of the village. Go see if there's anything left.

Content_200205_4.ContentEN: Turns out there is a book in the box. Take it back to Icelake and give it to Brunetto.

Content_200205_5.ContentEN: You found Brunetto's storage box, but it's locked.

Content_200205_6.ContentEN: You found the key to the box. Now go open Brunetto's storage box.

Content_200206_1.ContentEN: As usual, head to The Asphodel to see if there are new commissions to take on. FYI, the tavern seems unusually \

Content_200206_2.ContentEN:
A spirited customer is standing on a table at The Asphodel, spouting incomprehensible words — but interestingly, he doesn't smell of alcohol.\
Have a chat with Camilla and learn more about this customer.

Content_200206_3.ContentEN:
As a playwright, Mr Buck is never stingy with his rhetorical flourishes, showcasing his literary prowess as a professional playwright.\
Right now, though, it seems Mr Buck is in dire need of a translator rather than applause. Try to make sense of his elaborate dictions.

Content_200206_4.ContentEN:
It turns out Mr Buck is agitated by a nocturnal intruder at his place. And just like that, a new commission has fallen into your lap.\
You can start by investigating around Mr Buck's residence.

Content_200206_5.ContentEN: Begin your investigation right at the doorstep of Mr Buck's residence.

Content_200206_6.ContentEN: Something catches your eye beneath the windowsill of Mr Buck's residence.

Content_200206_7.ContentEN:
Traces of children's footprints and scattered popcorn near Mr Buck's residence remind you of someone who works by the theatre.\
Piecing the clues together, you prepare to confront the enigmatic \

Content_200206_8.ContentEN:
You've learned why Arnold sneaked into Mr Buck's home at midnight, but only Mr Buck has the right to decide what to do about it.\
Return to The Asphodel with Arnold and your findings.

Content_200207_1.ContentEN:
A Memorial Week event is ongoing near the monument at Silverpeace Square, where a school group is gathered for the occasion. A student honoured for her excellence will present flowers at the monument after the speech.\
Go take a look.

Content_200207_2.ContentEN: Emma, the student presenting flowers, seems preoccupied. While she's alone and lost in thought, it might be a good time to ask what's on her mind.

Content_200207_3.ContentEN:
Emma has recently befriended an elderly Charon woman from the slums. However, due to today's event, Emma had to cancel their little get-together.\
It is very nice of you to offer to help her deliver a doll she made to the elderly lady.

Content_200207_4.ContentEN: In the slums, you found the \

Content_200207_5.ContentEN:
Belinda noted that you've recently lost someone important and hinted at an eventual reunion.\
She wanted to give you a gift made from an iron item infused with your essence. Maybe you can find something like that on Purgatorio Island.

Content_200207_6.ContentEN: You found an iron wire that carries your essence from the place you once called home. It's time to head back to Icelake and give the wire to Belinda to see what kind of gift she has for you.

Content_200208_1.ContentEN:
Neighbours report seeing strange figures inside Hypnos' House, which is supposed to be vacant.\
What could be going on? Head to the Hypnos' House and find out.

Content_200208_2.ContentEN: Inside Hypnos' House, you've encountered a strange lady. Go talk to her.

Content_200208_3.ContentEN:
You've learned that Lina used to work as a housekeeper at Hypnos' House. Together, you realised that the key you got from Margie could probably unlock the chest containing Henrik's will. \
Find the will and witness its revelation.

Content_200209_1.ContentEN: Dr Luna holding a stack of prescriptions near Silverpeace Square catches your attention. She might be connected to one of the items you got from Margie. Go talk to her.

Content_200210_1.ContentEN: You've made it to the black market, where a shady merchant catches your eye. Go introduce yourself.

Content_200210_2.ContentEN: Follow the black marketeer Harlowe's directions to the specified spot near Lamenting Lake to fulfil the commission.

Content_200210_3.ContentEN: The target area is overrun with Filthoids. Defeat them.

Content_200210_4.ContentEN: You've successfully dealt with the Filthoids. Now, it's time to claim your rightful reward from Harlowe.

Content_200210_7.ContentEN:
Rumours suggest a secret black market operates in Icelake's sewers. Countless shady deals have been made there. \
As a sharp and skilled Phoxhunter, it's your duty to delve into the sewers and investigate.

Content_200211_1.ContentEN: Near the highway outside Icelake, you find a human girl who believes she's a Charon. Find out what's troubling her.

Content_200211_2.ContentEN: Faye, upset and bullied by her classmates, ran off with her ears covered. Find this troubled girl and comfort her.

Content_200211_3.ContentEN:
After a brief chat with Faye, you learn that her classmates have been bullying her.\
It's time to teach those bullies a lesson and help Faye stand up for herself.

Content_200211_4.ContentEN:
After a brief chat with Faye, you learn that her classmates have been bullying her.\
It's time to teach those bullies a lesson and help Faye stand up for herself.

Content_200211_5.ContentEN: After a good thrashing, Faye's classmates back down. Make sure they understand the consequences of messing with her again.

Content_200212_2.ContentEN:
Near Glevum Pit, you notice a miner behaving suspiciously. His sack of stones stained with what looks like blood.\
Something feels off. Reporting this to Kevin, a soldier at the city gates, seems like the safest move.

Content_200212_3.ContentEN: As it turns out, Kevin has already received a report about this. As a helpful resident of Icelake, you agree to guide Kevin back to Larry's location for further investigation.

Content_200212_4.ContentEN:
Larry becomes alarmed at the sight of you and Kevin. He panics and attacks in desperation.\
Defeat him to calm the situation.

Content_200212_5.ContentEN:
You've managed to subdue Larry, and he finally calms down.\
Now, talk to him to uncover the whole story.

Content_200213_1.ContentEN:
You've been in Icelake for a while now. Despite the relentless cold, Margie has been a beacon of warmth in the slums — you can always see her distributing supplies to those in need.\
It's been a while since you helped her chase down the thief in the sewers. It's time to catch up with her.

Content_200213_2.ContentEN:
As Margie said, things that seem worthless can sometimes hold great value. Even the rubbish bins scattered around the city might hide untold stories.\
The 3 items you got from Margie: a prescription, a box of paper stars, and a key, each one holds a mystery of its own. Follow the clues showed on these 3 things to uncover the stories behind them!

Content_200213_3.ContentEN:
Having investigated the stories of the 3 things you got from Margie, your view of Icelake has changed.\
Return to Mist Aken and catch up with Margie.

Content_200213_4.ContentEN: After investigating the stories behind the three items, it's time to meet Margie and tell her your findings.

Content_200215_1.ContentEN: You've noticed a cook named Marcus near Lamenting Lake. Although he often mutters strange things to himself, he doesn't seem like a bad guy. Go say hi.

Content_200215_2.ContentEN: During your conversation, you've learned that Marcus loves experimenting with new recipes. He's currently in search of some essential marinade ingredients. Help him find them.

Content_200215_3.ContentEN: You've gathered the marinade ingredients Marcus needs. Take them to him.

Content_200215_4.ContentEN:
Even though his dishes are still hard to stomach, you've agreed to be Marcus's culinary partner. \
Now, let's see what his next culinary creation will be.

Content_200215_5.ContentEN: Marcus's experimental dishes haven't been an instant hit, but he's not giving up. He needs some obese Frostspines for his next recipe. Help him gather some.

Content_200215_6.ContentEN: Great job! There's no one better at fishing than you. Take the freshly caught obese Frostspines to Marcus.

Content_200215_7.ContentEN:
It's been a while since you last saw Marcus. You wonder how the tenacious chef is faring with his culinary creations.\
You've heard he's been hanging around the city gate lately. Go see how he's doing.

Content_200215_8.ContentEN: Marcus is sitting on a bench by the gates of Icelake. Go talk to him.

Content_200216_1.ContentEN: You've heard about a sketchy treasure chest outside Icelake. Go check it out.

Content_200216_2.ContentEN:
You find the chest by the roadside, but there doesn't seem to be anything special about it.\
No need to overthink it — just go open it.

Content_200216_3.ContentEN:
As you attempt to open the chest, three men suddenly pop out, calling themselves the Imperial Three and claiming ownership of the chest.\
Since reasoning with them won't work, it seems you'll have to settle things the hard way.

Content_200216_4.ContentEN: After defeating the Imperial Three, they seem to have something to tell you.

Content_200217_1.ContentEN: Dean, a liquor vendor outside The Asphodel, seems to have some complaints about Camilla. Find out what's going on.

Content_200218_1.ContentEN:
You find yourself back here once again. That sweet girl's last trembling words seem to still echo in the air.\
At this moment, a mysterious woman is murmuring under her breath as if in prayer, her whispers like a benediction from Mother Embla, offering solace to the mournful soul lingering over these frostbitten cliffs...

Content_200219_1.ContentEN:
Outside Icelake, the train runs its endless cycle, its whistle welcoming travellers from afar and bidding farewell to those venturing beyond.\
Something seems amiss at the ticket booth today — it might be worth investigating.

Content_200219_2.ContentEN: This foreign merchant seems to be in trouble. Go talk to him.

Content_200219_3.ContentEN: As a warm-hearted Phoxhunter, it's unthinkable to ignore a traveller in distress. Time to sort things out with the unfriendly ticket seller.

Content_200220_1.ContentEN: As a dedicated Phoxhunter, you make it a point not to miss any interesting commissions. Head to The Asphodel and pick up some new gigs.

Content_200220_2.ContentEN: You notice an unfamiliar waiter standing by the bulletin board, mumbling to himself. Go introduce yourself and find out what's on his mind.

Content_200220_3.ContentEN: After teaming up with Outsider, Snow suggests a contest to determine who gets the honour of naming your new team.

Content_200220_4.ContentEN:
After teaming up with Outsider, Snow suggests a contest to determine who gets the honour of naming your new team.\
According to Snow, Lunoxplorer near Sanctuary knows how the contest works. Go speak with her.

Content_200220_5.ContentEN:
With Lunoxplorer as the judge, the first round is about to begin!\
Head to the designated location to start the challenge.

Content_200220_6.ContentEN: The challenge begins! Follow the glowing circles marked by Lunoxplorer to reach the finish line!

Content_200220_7.ContentEN:
With Lunoxplorer as the judge, the second round is about to begin!\
Head to the designated location to start the challenge.

Content_200220_8.ContentEN: The challenge begins! Take aim and pop the balloons made by Lunosmith!

Content_200220_9.ContentEN:
Congratulations! You've outmatched Outsider and won the contest.\
Now's your chance to come up with a cool name for your new Phoxhunter team.

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_105.ContentEN: Drainage process halted. Please turn on the valve.

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_106.ContentEN: Water level exceeds the safety threshold by 90%. Protect the drainage system.

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_1061.ContentEN: Water level exceeds the safety threshold by 60%. Protect the drainage system.

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_1062.ContentEN: Water level exceeds the safety threshold by 30%. Protect the drainage system.

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_107.ContentEN: The drainage system has been destroyed. Mission failed.

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_108.ContentEN: Drainage system self-destructs in 50s. Open the valve now!

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_109.ContentEN: Drainage system self-destructs in 40s. Open the valve now!

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_110.ContentEN: Drainage system self-destructs in 30s. Open the valve now!

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_111.ContentEN: Drainage system self-destructs in 20s. Open the valve now!

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_112.ContentEN: Drainage system self-destructs in 10s. Open the valve now!

DUNGEON_DEFENCE_113.ContentEN: Drainage system self-destructs in 5s. Open the valve now!

DUNGEON_ENGINE_102.ContentEN: Phoxynamo Wheel access unlocked. Ready for activation.

DUNGEON_ENTER_FAILED_TOAST.ContentEN: Commission start failed: Insufficient Sanergy of teammate(s) (<H>%s</>)

DUNGEON_EXTERMINATE_101.ContentEN: Terminate a specific number of enemies within the stage.

DUNGEON_EXTERMINATE_102.ContentEN: You may retreat once you have terminated enough enemies.

DUNGEON_HIJACK_104.ContentEN: Stay by the vehicle, escort it to the end

DUNGEON_HIJACK_112.ContentEN: Approach to activate the vehicle. Shield will be consumed to maintain activation until the destination is reached.

DUNGEON_HIJACK_113.ContentEN: Obstacles on the route will block the way. Destroy them to proceed.

DUNGEON_HIJACK_114.ContentEN: Enemies at checkpoints will hinder the vehicle's progress. Eliminate all enemies to continue.

DUNGEON_HIJACK_115.ContentEN: Insufficient Shield. Vehicle halted for safety reasons.

DUNGEON_HIJACK_117.ContentEN: Insufficient Shield/Too far away. Vehicle halted.

DUNGEON_HIJACK_118.ContentEN: Hellfire is unable to activate the vehicle. Proceed anyway?

DUNGEON_PAOTAI_103.ContentEN: Garage door has been completely damaged

DUNGEON_RESCUE_101.ContentEN: Locate the <H>Secret Cell</> that's holding the target, crack the mechanism, and secure the target.

DUNGEON_RESCUE_102.ContentEN: Try to avoid detection by the enemy <H>Patrollers</> around the <H>Secret Cells</>. If spotted, defeat them quickly to prevent them from sounding the alarm.

DUNGEON_RESCUE_103.ContentEN: If you fail to stop the Patrollers from sounding the alarm, the target will be in danger. Find the target before the <H>countdown</> expires, or the Commission will fail.

DUNGEON_RESCUE_104.ContentEN: After rescuing the target, escort them to the evacuation point. Please vigilantly ensure their safety throughout the trip.

DUNGEON_RESCUE_105.ContentEN: The Commission is considered complete once the target is successfully escorted to the evacuation point.

DUNGEON_SABOTAGE_100.ContentEN: Crack the mechanism to expose the fuse of Supreme Glory

DUNGEON_SABOTAGE_102.ContentEN: (Optional) Locate and defeat the members of The Forsakens

DUNGEON_SABOTAGE_110.ContentEN: Find and expose the detonator of Supreme Glory

DUNGEON_SABOTAGE_111.ContentEN: <Highlight>Bouncepad</> helps you make a swifter retreat.

DUNGEON_SABOTAGE_112.ContentEN: Before exposing the detonator of Supreme Glory, you can defeat the leader of The Forsakens in the area first to make the subsequent challenge easier.

DUNGEON_SABOTAGE_113.ContentEN: Once the <Highlight>detonator</> of Supreme Glory is exposed, quickly destroy it to neutralise the mechanism.

DUNGEON_SABOTAGE_114.ContentEN: After destroying the detonator of Supreme Glory, head to the evacuation point as fast as possible for greater rewards.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_100.ContentEN: Entered the range of the Potion Station

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_101.ContentEN: Potion Station too far away. Buff expiring

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_102.ContentEN: Select a Potion Station and head there

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_109.ContentEN: The Potion Station has run out of Serum.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_110.ContentEN: The Potion Station will collect Serum from defeated enemies nearby. The more Serum stored in the Potion Station, the stronger the buffs it provides.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_111.ContentEN: A Primander - Corrosion is about to appear!

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_114.ContentEN: Serum starts at <Highlight>100%</>; after interacting with the device, Serum decreases over time; when it reaches <Highlight>0%</>, the commission fails.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_115.ContentEN: There's a chance that enemies will drop Serum when they're defeated. Picking it up increases Serum by <Highlight>5%</>.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_116.ContentEN: Find Serum storage points, each of which increases Serum by <Highlight>15%</>. The icon on the left shows the number of Serum storage points discovered.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_117.ContentEN: Every <Highlight>three minutes</>, you get to choose to retreat or continue.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_118.ContentEN: After interacting with the device, Serum starts to drop continuously; if it falls to <Highlight>0%</>, the commission fails. Quickly locate a Potion Station and extract Serum.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_119.ContentEN: Potion Stations provide <Highlight>Resource</>, and grant <Highlight>Attack</> or <Highlight>Healing</> buffs. Different Potion Stations have different functions.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_120.ContentEN: The Potion Station will collect Serum from defeated enemies nearby. The more Serum stored in the Potion Station, the stronger the buffs it provides.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_121.ContentEN: Approach the Potion Station and <Highlight>hold the interaction key to extract Serum to help you survive</>.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_122.ContentEN: After <Highlight>three minutes</>, you can choose to evacuate or continue the battle to earn more rewards.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_123.ContentEN: During this phase, no new enemies or Serum storage points will appear in the battle. Discovered Serum and Serum storage points will also disappear. If you don't reach the evacuation point within <Highlight>two minutes</>, the mission fails.

DUNGEON_SURVIVALPRO_124.ContentEN: Buff effect provided by the Potion Station:

DUNGEON_TITLE_CONFIRMING.ContentEN: Do you want to accept this invite?

GACHA_DES_MUSTUP.ContentEN:
You are guaranteed to obtain a 4★ or better character/weapon within every <highlight>10</> Retraces, and the featured 5★ character within <highlight>90</> Retraces.\
Each account can make no more than <highlight>90</> Retraces in the Destined Chrono. After obtaining the featured 5★ character, the Destined Chrono will close.

GACHA_DES_NORMAL.ContentEN:
You are guaranteed to obtain a 4★ or better character/weapon within every <highlight>10</> Retraces, and a 5★ character/weapon within <highlight>90</> Retraces.\
The count of Retraces for the Standard Chrono is tallied separately and does not carry over to other Chronos.

GACHA_DES_START.ContentEN:
You are guaranteed to obtain a 4★ or better character/weapon within every <highlight>10</> Retraces, and a 5★ character within <highlight>50</> Retraces.\
Each account can make no more than <highlight>50</> Retraces in the Fare Forth Andante Chrono. The Fare Forth Andante Chrono will remain available until all 50 attempts have been exhausted.

GACHA_DES_UP.ContentEN:
You are guaranteed to obtain a 4★ or better character/weapon within every <highlight>10</> Retraces, and a 5★ character within <highlight>90</> Retraces.\
The probability of winning the featured character in this Chrono is significantly increased.

GACHA_DES_WEAPON_UP.ContentEN:
You are guaranteed to obtain a 4★ or better character/weapon within every <highlight>10</> Retraces, and the featured 5★ weapon within <highlight>80</> Retraces.\
The featured weapon won't be added to the Standard Chrono after its event duration ends.

GACHA_SUBTITLE_100UP.ContentEN: 5★ drop guaranteed to be the featured character

GACHA_WARNING_MUSTUP.ContentEN:
<Title>About Chrono Drop Rates</>\
In this Chrono, the base probability of winning a 5★ character is <highlight>0.6%</>, with an overall rate (incl. guarantees) of <highlight>1.6%</>. You are guaranteed to obtain the featured 5★ character \

GACHA_WARNING_NORMAL.ContentEN:
<Title>About Chrono Drop Rates</>\
5★ Characters and Weapons\
The base probability of winning a 5★ character/weapon is <highlight>0.6%</> (<highlight>0.3%</> for a 5★ character and <highlight>0.3%</> for a 5★ weapon), with an overall rate (incl. guarantees) of <highlight>1.6%</>. You are guaranteed to obtain a 5★ character/weapon within <highlight>90</> Retraces.\
4★ Characters and Weapons\
The base probability of winning a 4★ character/weapon is <highlight>5.1%</>, with an overall rate (incl. guarantees) of <highlight>13.0%</>. You are guaranteed to obtain a 4★ or better character/weapon within every <highlight>10</> Retraces. The probability of winning a 4★ character/weapon through a guarantee is <highlight>99.4%</>, and for a 5★ character is <highlight>0.6%</>.\
In cases of drop rate boosts and guarantees, please refer to the corresponding rules. Otherwise, the base probabilities apply to all characters and weapons.\
\
<Title>About Duplicate Items</>\
On obtaining a 5★ character that you already own, from the 2nd to the 7th time, you'll receive the character's Intron x<highlight>1</> and Brilliant Grit x<highlight>50</>; from the 8th time onwards, you'll receive Brilliant Grit x<highlight>125</>.\
On obtaining a 4★ character that you already own, from the 2nd to the 7th time, you'll receive the character's Intron x<highlight>1</> and Brilliant Grit x<highlight>10</>; from the 8th time onwards, you'll receive Brilliant Grit x<highlight>25</>.\
Every 5★ weapon won in this Chrono comes with Brilliant Grit x<highlight>25</>; Every 4★ weapon won in this Chrono comes with Brilliant Grit x<highlight>5</>; Every 3★ weapon won in this Chrono comes with Pristine Grit x<highlight>20</>.\
\
The count of Retraces for the Standard Chrono is tallied separately and does not carry over to other Chronos.

GACHA_WARNING_START.ContentEN:
<Title>About Chrono Drop Rates</>\
In this Chrono, the base probability of winning a 5★ character is <highlight>0.6%</>, with an overall rate (incl. guarantees) of <highlight>1.6%</>. You are guaranteed to obtain a 5★ character within <highlight>50</> Retraces.\
The base probability of winning a 4★ character/weapon is <highlight>5.1%</>, with an overall rate (incl. guarantees) of <highlight>13.0%</>. You are guaranteed to obtain a 4★ or better character/weapon within every <highlight>10</> Retraces. The probability of winning a 4★ character/weapon through a guarantee is <highlight>99.4%</>, and for a 5★ character is <highlight>0.6%</>.\
\
<Title>About Duplicate Items</>\
On obtaining a 5★ character that you do not own, you'll also receive Brilliant Grit x<highlight>50</>. On obtaining a 5★ character that you already own, from the 2nd to the 7th time, you'll receive the character's Intron x<highlight>1</> and Brilliant Grit x<highlight>50</>; from the 8th time onwards, you'll receive Brilliant Grit x<highlight>125</>.\
On obtaining a 4★ character that you do not own, you'll also receive Brilliant Grit x<highlight>10</>. On obtaining a 4★ character that you already own, from the 2nd to the 7th time, you'll receive the character's Intron x<highlight>1</> and Brilliant Grit x<highlight>10</>; from the 8th time onwards, you'll receive Brilliant Grit x<highlight>25</>.\
Every 5★ weapon won in this Chrono comes with Brilliant Grit x<highlight>25</>; Every 4★ weapon won in this Chrono comes with Brilliant Grit x<highlight>5</>; Every 3★ weapon won in this Chrono comes with Pristine Grit x<highlight>20</>.\
\
The count of Retraces for the Starter Chrono is tallied separately and does not carry over to other Chronos.

GACHA_WARNING_UP.ContentEN:
<Title>About Chrono Drop Rates</>\
The base probability of winning a 5★ character is <highlight>0.6%</>, with an overall rate (incl. guarantees) of <highlight>1.6%</>. You are guaranteed to obtain a 5★ character within <highlight>50</> Retraces.\
In this Chrono, when you win a 5★ character, there's a <highlight>50%</> chance it will be the featured character \

GACHA_WARNING_WEAPON_UP.ContentEN:
<Title>About Chrono Drop Rates</>\
In this Chrono, the base probability of winning a 5★ weapon is <highlight>0.8%</>, with an overall rate (incl. guarantees) of <highlight>1.87%</>. You are guaranteed to obtain the featured 5★ weapon \

GRADEUP_1101_01.ContentEN: Upon performing Helix Leap or using [Faintlight], Berenica gains 1 stack that increases damage by #1 for #2s, up to 3 stacks.

GRADEUP_1101_02.ContentEN: Deals #3 more damage to targets with a HP percentage lower than Berenica.

GRADEUP_1101_04.ContentEN: Increases Berenica's Attack by #4 per Combo Level.

GRADEUP_1101_06.ContentEN: When in [Netherflames] state, each attack has a chance to unleash 1 additional Swordwave, with a chance determined by [Ymir]'s Trigger Probability.

GRADEUP_1801_01.ContentEN: Enemies in [Boisterous Tea Party] take #1 more corresponding elemental damage.

GRADEUP_1801_02.ContentEN: Each stack of [Taleweaver Quill] increases Fina's Skill Damage by #2 and Skill Range by #3.

GRADEUP_1801_04.ContentEN: Gains 2 additional stacks of [Taleweaver Quill] when using [\

GRADEUP_1801_06.ContentEN:
When dealing weapon damage to targets within [Boisterous Tea Party], converts the elemental type of this damage to the one corresponding to the target's Elemental Weakness.\
If the target has no Elemental Weakness, converts elemental type of this damage to the current [Boisterous Tea Party] element type.

GRADEUP_2101_01.ContentEN: When triggering bonus effect, inflicts 1 stack of [Poison of Love] on the target.

GRADEUP_2101_02.ContentEN: Increases the maximum number of [Summon: Aurelia Aurita] allowed on the battlefield to 5 and the stack cap of [Poison of Love] to 8.

GRADEUP_2101_04.ContentEN: Takes #1 less damage from targets inflicted with [Poison of Love].

GRADEUP_2101_06.ContentEN: When defeating a target inflicted with [Poison of Love], gains 1 stack that increases Rebecca's Attack by #2 for #4s, up to #3 stacks. The duration refreshes with each stack gained.

GRADEUP_2301_01.ContentEN: Increases the number of [Summon: Tentacles] summoned through [Brawl For Justice!] to 12. The maximum number of [Summon: Tentacles] that can exist at the same time increases to 24.

GRADEUP_2301_02.ContentEN: When [Summon: Tentacle] deals damage, there is a #1 chance to replenish 1 projectile for Tabethe. This effect can only be triggered once every second.

GRADEUP_2301_03.ContentEN: [Tabethe's Specialty!] Level +2; [Have Tricks, Will Travel!] Level +1.

GRADEUP_2301_04.ContentEN: For each [Summon: Tentacle] on the field, increases Tabethe's CRIT Chance by #2.

GRADEUP_2301_05.ContentEN: [Brawl For Justice!] Level +2; [Have Tricks, Will Travel!] Level +1.

GRADEUP_2301_06.ContentEN: Enemies captured by [Summon: Tentacle] take Hydro Damage equivalent to #3 of the Tentacle's ATK once every 2s.

GRADEUP_2401_01.ContentEN:
Increases Fushu's Morale by #1.\
[Nine-Needle Therapy] increases the target's Morale by #2.

GRADEUP_2401_02.ContentEN: Increases the maximum number of [Summon: Yunchi] allowed on the battlefield to #4 and the maximum number of their attacking targets to #3.

GRADEUP_2401_04.ContentEN: When a [Summon: Yunchi] heals a target, if the healing overflows, the target restores an additional #5 points of Sanity. This effect can only be triggered once every 3 seconds.

GRADEUP_2401_06.ContentEN: Targets with [Nine-Needle Therapy] can directly trigger the effect of [Brimful of Vitality] when consuming Sanity.

GRADEUP_3101_01.ContentEN: Gains 6 stacks of [Preloaded] upon entering combat, and increases Morale by #4 for #5s.

GRADEUP_3101_02.ContentEN: During [Gunpowder Revelry], reduces Damage Taken by #1, and decreases the interval of gaining the ATK Speed boost to 0.06s.

GRADEUP_3101_04.ContentEN: Increases damage dealt to targets with a HP percentage lower than #3 by #4.

GRADEUP_3101_06.ContentEN: During [Gunpowder Revelry], when triggering bonus effects using [Hansel and Gretel], inflicts [Laceration] on the target(s) for #6s.

GRADEUP_3102_01.ContentEN: When using [Wholehearted Service], summons 2 more [Light Dirtexpellers], and decreases the target's damage by #1 for #2s.

GRADEUP_3102_02.ContentEN:
Increases the length of [Hyperthermal Purgejet] by 50%.\
When [Hyperthermal Purgejet] deals damage, inflicts 1 stack that increases the target's Damage Taken from [Hilda] by #3 for #4s, up to 10 stacks.

GRADEUP_3102_04.ContentEN: Hilda's [Dirtexpellers] have a [50% + 20% × Hilda's ranged weapon Multishot value] chance to fire 1 additional projectile when shooting.

GRADEUP_3102_06.ContentEN:
Increases the stack cap of [Dust Off] and [Deep Cleaning] to 10.\
Decreases the interval of gaining [Deep Cleaning] during [Pyrolytic Cleaning] to 0.5s.

GRADEUP_3103_01.ContentEN: If a [Tot Popper] is detonated by a different type of [Tot Popper], restores #1 point of Sanity for Yale and Oliver; if detonated by the same type, restores #2 points of Sanity.

GRADEUP_3103_02.ContentEN: Decreases the Movement Speed of enemies in [Nightmare Lab] by #3.

GRADEUP_3103_03.ContentEN: [Tot Popper] Level +2; [The Rules of Bomb] Level +1.

GRADEUP_3103_04.ContentEN: When deploying a [Tot Popper] in [Nightmare Lab], there's a #4 chance to deploy 1 additional [Tot Popper].

GRADEUP_3103_05.ContentEN: [Nightmare's Grasp] Level +2; [The Rules of Bomb] Level +1.

GRADEUP_3103_06.ContentEN: When applied with [Bombing Frenzy], each deployed [Tot Popper] combines the features of both types, dealing higher damage and posing greater Stance reduction.

GRADEUP_3201_01.ContentEN: Increases damage dealt to enemies within a 6-metre radius around Hellfire by #1.

GRADEUP_3201_02.ContentEN: For each enemy within a 6-metre radius around Hellfire, additionally restores Hellfire's HP by #2 of her Max HP per second, up to #3.

GRADEUP_3201_04.ContentEN: Decreases the interval of dealing [Puncture Retribution] Pyro Damage to 1.4s.

GRADEUP_3201_06.ContentEN: For every 5 times the nearby teammate(s) consume(s) Sanity to use their skill(s), Hellfire automatically uses [Cage of Despair] once.

GRADEUP_3301_01.ContentEN: When [Margie's Combustible Bin] consumes [Jackpot!] stacks, there's a #1 chance to regain the consumed stacks.

GRADEUP_3301_02.ContentEN: When using [Margie's Treasure Shovel], there's a #2 chance to deal additional damage to 1 random enemy within range once.

GRADEUP_3301_03.ContentEN: [Margie's Treasure Shovel] Level +2; [Margie's Recycling Sack] Level +1.

GRADEUP_3301_04.ContentEN: Increases the duration of Zealous Zone created by [Margie's Combustible Bin] to 20s.

GRADEUP_3301_05.ContentEN: [Margie's Combustible Bin] Level +2; [Margie's Recycling Sack] Level +1.

GRADEUP_3301_06.ContentEN: When [Margie's Combustible Bin] deals damage, increases the target's Pyro Damage Taken by #5 for #4s.

GRADEUP_4201_01.ContentEN: When dealing skill damage, there's a #5 chance to add 1 Combo Point.

GRADEUP_4201_02.ContentEN:
When dealing skill damage, inflicts [Overawe] on the target for #6s.\
[Overawe]: Increases Damage Taken from [Yuming] by #3.

GRADEUP_4201_04.ContentEN: Damage dealt to enemies with a HP percentage higher than #1 is increased by #2.

GRADEUP_4201_06.ContentEN: With 5 or more stacks of [Allegiance], Plunging Attack deals #4 additional Electro Damage.

GRADEUP_4202_01.ContentEN: When [Barrier] absorbs damage from projectiles, inflicts 1 stack of [Overwork Grudge] on the attacker for 3s, up to 2 stacks. [Overwork Grudge] is only stackable in this way.

GRADEUP_4202_02.ContentEN: Each Randy's level increases his Ultra Shield cap by #1 points.

GRADEUP_4202_04.ContentEN: Target hit by [Impact] immediately incur the total damage of all [Overwork Grudge] stacks inflicted on the target.

GRADEUP_4202_06.ContentEN: When dealing non-periodic damage, deals additional Electro Damage equivalent to #2 of Randy's [Shield points + Ultra Shield points].

GRADEUP_4301_01.ContentEN: When the [Chaotic Thunderorb] takes damage from [Thunderbolt], increases the Damage Taken Transfer ratio by #3, up to 4 times.

GRADEUP_4301_02.ContentEN:
Increases [Might of Thunder] point cap to 600. \
Each point of [Might of Thunder] increases [Thunderbolt] damage by #1.\
Each point of [Might of Thunder] increases the Damage Taken Transfer ratio of [Summon: Chaotic Thunderorb] by #2.

GRADEUP_4301_04.ContentEN: When using [Divine Conqueror] by long press, increases the frequency of summoning [Thunderbolt] by 25%.

GRADEUP_4301_06.ContentEN: When an enemy is linked to the [Chaotic Thunderorb] for the first time, Sibylle summons a [Thunderbolt] at the target's location, which guarantees the triggering of Bonus Effect: Electro.

GRADEUP_5101_01.ContentEN: Decreases the losing speed of [Passion For Work] by 50%.

GRADEUP_5101_02.ContentEN: When using a skill, applies an Attack boost equivalent to #1 of [Truffle]'s Max HP to her teammate(s) for #2s, with a maximum increase of #5.

GRADEUP_5101_04.ContentEN: Increases the stack cap of [Heavyweight] to 15. When Truffle starts mounting [Filbert], gains 15 stacks of [Heavyweight].

GRADEUP_5101_05.ContentEN: [Tummy Full, Hands Full] Level +2; [Chop-Chop, Commissaries!] Level +1.

GRADEUP_5101_06.ContentEN: After picking up [Activated Sal Volatile], [Tranquilizer Dewdrop], or [Ammo Supply Chest], Truffle gains 1 stack that increases her Skill Damage by #3 for #4s, up to #6 stacks.

GRADEUP_5301_01.ContentEN: Restores Psyche's HP by 10% of the Max HP when using [Phototaxis]. When [Ethereal Powder] or [Powder Stigma] deals damage, there's a #1 chance to create a [Phantasm] at the target's location.

GRADEUP_5301_02.ContentEN: While in [Flamboyance] state, gains the [Eclosion] effect: Immune to Hitstun when taking damage, increases Damage Dealt by #2 and decreases Damage Taken by #6.

GRADEUP_5301_04.ContentEN: When dealing CRIT Damage, there's a #3 chance to gain a #5-point Ultra Shield and recover #4 points of Sanity. Can only be triggered once per second.

GRADEUP_5301_06.ContentEN: While in [Flamboyance] state, increases Berserker by #7. The count cap of [Amberlight] buffs is increased to #8.

MESSAGE_LOADING_10_PC.ContentEN: A secluded isle perched atop the open seas at the border of Hyperborea and Elysium. The Elysian built a shrine there a millennium ago, but now only ruins whisper of its past glory.

MESSAGE_LOADING_11_PC.ContentEN: A city on the northern frontier of the Hyperborean Empire, intrinsically linked to the empire's genesis and formerly a major Phoxene hub. Its relentless cold and snowstorms serve as its staunchest guardians.

MESSAGE_LOADING_13_PC.ContentEN: Among the Charons, those with unique talents possess varied magical powers, branded as \

MESSAGE_LOADING_14_PC.ContentEN: These monsters, widespread and often roaming in packs across the wilds, pose a danger not to be underestimated by ordinary beings.

MESSAGE_LOADING_15_PC.ContentEN: A friendly race that is also called the Lunos and coexists with human beings, resembling human children but distinguished by their moonlight-white hair, hence the name. Known for their well-intentioned but often misguided attempts to help humans, their actions sometimes lead to more chaos than aid.

MESSAGE_LOADING_16_PC.ContentEN:
An imperial nation located in the northern part of Atlasia. Venerating martial conquest and alchemical prowess, it is constantly embroiled in conflict with the Elysian Church.\
Beneath its glorious crown thrives a legacy of valour and iron. All glory to the Emperor.

MESSAGE_LOADING_17_PC.ContentEN: Situated in the southern reaches of Atlasia is a realm devoted to the divine, heeding the decrees of nine deities and preserving an ancient, orderly governance. The resplendent, most enduring land, like a piece of Phoxene perched upon high branches, promises unparalleled joy and a bright tomorrow.

MESSAGE_LOADING_18_PC.ContentEN:
To the east of Atlasia lies a land with magnificent pavilions and palaces that dominate the skyline. It is the ancestral land of the Starweavers, known across the continent for their talent for commerce.\
Guided by stars, they craft beauty from the earth's bounty; their sublime chants become poetry, an ode to serene solitude.

MESSAGE_LOADING_19_PC.ContentEN: Crouch and slide to navigate through low, narrow gaps.

MESSAGE_LOADING_1_PC.ContentEN: Press &Slide& and then &Jump& to Helix Leap over cliffs or cover long distances

MESSAGE_LOADING_1_Phone.ContentEN: Hold the Jump button and swipe upwards to the right to Helix Leap over cliffs or cover long distances.

MESSAGE_LOADING_20_PC.ContentEN: Use Helix Leap for rapid movement, which also allows access to usually unreachable places.

MESSAGE_LOADING_21_PC.ContentEN:
Upon completely disrupting an elite enemy's Stance, you can unleash Ask's Retribution to deal substantial damage.\
Ask is the revered Father God among the Charons.

MESSAGE_LOADING_22_PC.ContentEN: Try talking to people in various cities. Regular interactions might gradually influence others' \

MESSAGE_LOADING_23_PC.ContentEN: When taking damage, Shield doesn't account for DEF stats. The Shield will regenerate after a period of time without damage.

MESSAGE_LOADING_24_PC.ContentEN: Once an elite enemy's Stance is disabled, they'll briefly cease actions and start recovering Stance, during which they'll receive increased damage. Make the most of this phase for a faster victory.

MESSAGE_LOADING_29_PC.ContentEN:
Slash: Deals more damage to target's Shield.\
Spike: Deals more damage to target's HP.\
Smash: Further weakens target's Stance.

MESSAGE_LOADING_2_PC.ContentEN: &Attack& when in mid-air to perform Plunging Attack

MESSAGE_LOADING_2_Phone.ContentEN: While in mid-air, tap the Attack button to execute a quick Plunging Attack upon landing.

MESSAGE_LOADING_30_PC.ContentEN: Deals periodic Umbro DMG and decreases the target's Stance recovery speed.

MESSAGE_LOADING_31_PC.ContentEN: Equipping Demon Wedges significantly empowers your characters and weapons. Some rare Wedges can even adorn the bearer's skill effects.

MESSAGE_LOADING_32_PC.ContentEN: Demon Wedges place a strain on the bearer, and the maximum amount of strain a bearer can handle is known as Tolerance. Elevating your character and weapon levels can increase this limit, allowing for more Wedges to be equipped for greater combat leverage.

MESSAGE_LOADING_33_PC.ContentEN: Each Demon Wedge has an affinity that resonates with certain Charons, which is known as Track. When a Wedge's Track matches the bearer's (character/weapon), it requires less Tolerance, while mismatching requires more.

MESSAGE_LOADING_34_PC.ContentEN: The latest innovation in Demon Wedge technology from the Imperial Alchemy Academy capable of altering the Track of slots.

MESSAGE_LOADING_35_PC.ContentEN: The Asphodel's specific quests for Phoxhunters. These commissions typically offer handsome rewards. Complete them to enhance team combat power.

MESSAGE_LOADING_36_PC.ContentEN: Don't let the endless enemy waves slow you down. Locating your target ASAP is key to nailing the commission quickly.

MESSAGE_LOADING_37_PC.ContentEN: Utilize Bouncepads to reach evacuation points more quickly after dealing with the evil Supreme Glory bombs.

MESSAGE_LOADING_38_PC.ContentEN: The more Serum a Potion Station holds, the stronger the buffs you'll receive near it. Keeping the station well-stocked can make battles significantly easier.

MESSAGE_LOADING_3_PC.ContentEN: &Attack& when sliding to perform Sliding Attack

MESSAGE_LOADING_3_Phone.ContentEN: Hold the Jump button and swipe left to execute a Sliding Attack.

MESSAGE_LOADING_4_PC.ContentEN: Raising an alarm will attract more enemies

MESSAGE_LOADING_5_PC.ContentEN: If your character gets stuck, go to \

MESSAGE_LOADING_6_PC.ContentEN: Attacking mechas can also deal damage to enemies

MESSAGE_LOADING_7_PC.ContentEN: Filthoids are violent creatures widely spread on the Atlasia Continent. Many of them are highly aggressive.

MESSAGE_LOADING_8_PC.ContentEN: The Hyperborean Empire is located in the northwest of the Atlasia Continent, with formidable military and highly-advanced Phoxichor technology.

MESSAGE_LOADING_9_PC.ContentEN: Phoxene is the most common mineral on the Atlasia Continent and also the foundation of Phoxichor technology.

MOD_ATTR_ExtraComboLevel.ContentEN: When performing a Charged Attack, Combo Level +#1.

MOD_ATTR_ExtraComboProb.ContentEN: When gaining Combo Point through attacking, there is a #1 chance to gain 1 additional Combo Point.

MOD_DESC_101001.ContentEN: Changes the Sword Normal Attack Move, allowing for swifter strikes.

MOD_DESC_102001.ContentEN: Changes the Polearm Charged Attack Move, allowing it to throw 5 polearms forward to attack enemies along the way.

MOD_DESC_102002.ContentEN: Changes the Polearm Plunging Attack Move, allowing it to additionally perform a larger-scale Plunging Attack.

MOD_DESC_103001.ContentEN: Changes the Greatsword Normal Attack Move, allowing the final hit to unleash 3 swordwaves to attack enemies along the way.

MOD_DESC_106001.ContentEN: Changes the Katana Charged Attack Move. Upon striking an enemy, the user leaps into the air and slams down, dealing multiple hits to surrounding foes.

MOD_DESC_1311.ContentEN: Decreases damage taken by #1. When defeating an enemy, increases ATK by #2 for #3s, up to #4 stacks. The effect duration refreshes with each stack gained.

MOD_DESC_1312.ContentEN: Increases Skill Damage by #1 for #2s when battle starts.

MOD_DESC_1400.ContentEN: Morale: The higher the HP percentage, the higher the damage dealt, up to #1.

MOD_DESC_1410.ContentEN: Berserker: The lower the HP percentage, the higher the damage dealt, up to #1.

MOD_DESC_1420.ContentEN: Skill Damage -#1. When attacking with a weapon, deals #2 additional damage of the same element.

MOD_DESC_1430.ContentEN: When consuming Sanity to use a skill, restores Sanity equivalent to #1 of the consumed Sanity for nearby teammate(s).

MOD_DESC_1502.ContentEN: During a Helix Leap, deals Anemo Damage equivalent to #1 of the character's Attack to nearby enemies.

MOD_DESC_1512.ContentEN: Defeating an enemy in mid-air refreshes the mid-air jump count, up to #1 time.

MOD_DESC_1513.ContentEN: When landing from a great height, deals Smash Damage equivalent to #1 of the character's Attack to nearby enemies.

MOD_DESC_1532.ContentEN: When dodging, deals Pyro Damage equivalent to #1 of the character's Attack to enemies around the starting point.

MOD_DESC_1601.ContentEN: Increases the stats of Demon Wedges prefixed with [Sphinx], [Siren], [Griffin], [Typhon], [Covenanter], and [Arbiter] by 20%.

MOD_DESC_1602.ContentEN: Increases the stats of Demon Wedges prefixed with [Sphinx], [Siren], [Griffin], [Typhon], [Covenanter], and [Bahamut] by 20%.

MOD_DESC_1603.ContentEN: Increases the stats of Demon Wedges prefixed with [Sphinx], [Siren], [Griffin], [Typhon], [Covenanter], and [Ifrit] by 20%.

MOD_DESC_1604.ContentEN: Increases the stats of Demon Wedges prefixed with [Sphinx], [Siren], [Griffin], [Typhon], [Covenanter], and [Summanus] by 20%.

MOD_DESC_1605.ContentEN: Increases the stats of Demon Wedges prefixed with [Sphinx], [Siren], [Griffin], [Typhon], [Covenanter], and [Hastur] by 20%.

MOD_DESC_1606.ContentEN: Increases the stats of Demon Wedges prefixed with [Sphinx], [Siren], [Griffin], [Typhon], [Covenanter], and [Helios] by 20%.

MOD_DESC_1911.ContentEN: When consuming Sanity, Umbro characters gain 1 stack that increases Skill Damage by #2 for #1s, up to #3 stacks.

MOD_DESC_1921.ContentEN: Hydro characters' summon gains an ATK Speed boost equal to #1 of the summoner's melee weapon ATK Speed and a Skill Range boost equal to #2 of the summoner's Skill Range.

MOD_DESC_1922.ContentEN: When a Hydro character uses a skill, all nearby teammate(s) (excluding the character) gain an Attack boost equal to #2 of the character's Attack, with a maximum increase of 120, for #1s.

MOD_DESC_1931.ContentEN: When a Pyro character deals damage, gains 1 stack that increases ATK by #2 for #1s, up to #3 stacks.

MOD_DESC_1941.ContentEN: When an Electro character deals damage, increases the damage dealt based on their remaining Sanity; the more the remaining Sanity, the greater the damage increase, up to #1 when the remaining Sanity points reaches #2.

MOD_DESC_1951.ContentEN: After an Anemo character uses their Ultimate Skill, increases the damage dealt by their Combat Skill by #2 for #1s. Each of the next 3 uses of Combat Skill restores #3 points of Sanity for the character.

MOD_DESC_1952.ContentEN: For each buff applied on a teammate around an Anemo character, increases Damage Dealt by the character by #1, up to a maximum of #2.

MOD_DESC_1961.ContentEN: Increases Damage taken by enemies near a Lumino character by #1. For each elemental Bonus Effect inflicted on the target, further increases the said damage taken by #1.

MOD_DESC_2301.ContentEN: Each Combo Level increases CRIT Chance by #1.

MOD_DESC_2302.ContentEN: Each Combo Level increases Trigger Probability by #1.

MOD_DESC_2311.ContentEN: When defeating an enemy, gains 1 stack that increases ATK Speed by #2 for #1s, up to #3 stacks.

MOD_DESC_2321.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effect: Smash, gains 1 stack that increases CRIT Damage by #2 for #1s, up to #3 stacks.

MOD_DESC_2322.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effects, gains 1 stack that increases ATK Range by #2 for #1s, up to #3 stacks.

MOD_DESC_2401.ContentEN: Increases damage dealt by Plunging Attack by #1.

MOD_DESC_2402.ContentEN: Increases damage dealt by Charged Attack by #1. Combo Level +#2 when performing Charged Attack.

MOD_DESC_2501.ContentEN: Increases damage dealt to Filthoids by #1.

MOD_DESC_2502.ContentEN: Increases damage dealt to Hyperborean soldiers by #1.

MOD_DESC_3301.ContentEN: After reloading, increases ATK Speed by #1 for #2s.

MOD_DESC_3311.ContentEN: When defeating an enemy, increases CRIT damage by #1 for #2s.

MOD_DESC_3321.ContentEN: When dealing CRIT damage, gains 1 stack that increases Trigger Probability by #1 for #2s, up to #3 stacks.

MOD_DESC_3322.ContentEN: When dealing CRIT Damage, there is a #1 chance to disarm the target.

MOD_DESC_3331.ContentEN: When triggering Bonus Effects, gains 1 stack that increases Multishot by #2 for #1s, up to #3 stacks.

MOD_DESC_3332.ContentEN: Upon triggering Bonus Effects, there is a #1 chance to reload 1 bullet.

MOD_DESC_3341.ContentEN: When dealing damage, increases the damage according to the percentage of the remaining projectiles. The higher the percentage, the greater the increase, up to #1.

MOD_DES_1001.ContentEN: A mysterious component crafted by the Alchademy. It can significantly enhance the combat capabilities of Daimons.

MONSTER_PROFILE_6004013.ContentEN: Serum rapidly decreases while the Primander: Corrosion is alive.

Mail_Content_100001.ContentEN: Thank you for completing the survey! We've prepared a gift for you~

Mail_Content_100002.ContentEN:
Dear Phoxhunter,\
\
Thank you for completing the survey! Please find your reward attached.\
We value every piece of feedback and suggestion you provide. Your input is essential in helping us enhance the overall quality of the game.

Mail_Content_100005.ContentEN: Dear Phoxhunter:/nYour unclaimed event rewards have been sent to your inbox. Best of luck on your future commissions.

Mail_Content_10005.TextMapContent:
感谢尊敬的狩月人参与本次测试，相关奖励已附在邮件中。\
请随意使用，来探索最适合自己的乐趣吧，游戏愉快~

Message_Guide_Achievement_1.ContentEN: You've completed an achievement. Go claim your reward!

Message_Guide_Achievement_2_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Achievements</> to open the Achievements page

Message_Guide_Achievement_2_Phone.ContentEN: Select <H>Achievements</> to open the Achievements page

Message_Guide_Achievement_3.ContentEN: Take on various challenges and complete more achievements in future adventures!

Message_Guide_Bag_1_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Inventory</> to open the Inventory page

Message_Guide_Bag_1_Phone.ContentEN: Tap the <H>Inventory</> icon in the upper left corner to open the Inventory page

Message_Guide_Bag_2.ContentEN: In Inventory, you can view acquired weapons, materials and other items, and also sell any unwanted items.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_1.ContentEN: In a safe spot, you can load up your <H>Tactical Backpack</> with all sorts of items to brace yourself for future battles!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_12.ContentEN: Drag the Combat Partner Sigil equipped with weapon into Tactical Backpack, and you're all set! Try <H>holding &OpenBattleWheel&</> in battle to summon a Combat Partner!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_12_1.ContentEN: Drag the Combat Partner Sigil equipped with weapon into Tactical Backpack, and you're all set! Try summoning a Combat Partner in battle!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_13_phone.ContentEN: Hold the button to open Tactical Backpack.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_14.ContentEN: Select a Combat Partner Sigil to set the weapon loadout.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_15.ContentEN: You can quickly equip your weapon with Demon Wedges at this page.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_4.ContentEN: <H>Drag</> various items into Tactical Backpack. <H>Hold &OpenBattleWheel&</> during combat to use these items — it's always good to be well-prepared!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_4_1.ContentEN: <H>Drag</> various items into Tactical Backpack. Using these items during combat — it's always good to be well-prepared!

Message_Guide_BattleBag_5.ContentEN: As a token of friendship, <H>Combat Partner Sigils</> can be used in combat to summon partners to help make the battle much easier. Before calling for a Combat Partner with a sigil, let's revisit the <H>Tactical Backpack</>.

Message_Guide_BattleBag_6.ContentEN: First off, let's arm our Combat Partners

Message_Guide_BattleBag_9.ContentEN: Each Combat Partner can be equipped with only one weapon (either melee or ranged). Each weapon can be assigned to only 1 Combat Partner.

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_1.ContentEN: You've just obtained a new weapon. Try it now!

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_11.ContentEN: Upgrading weapons consumes a certain amount of <H>Coins</> and <H>Weapon Manuals</>

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_12.ContentEN: Weapon attributes can be viewed here

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_13.ContentEN: You can access your weapon list here.

Message_Guide_ChangeWeapon_4.ContentEN: In Armoury, you can view, replace, or upgrade characters and their melee, ranged, or Consonance weapons.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_1_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Combat</> to open the Combat page

Message_Guide_Dungeon_1_Phone.ContentEN: Tap the <H>Combat</> icon to open the Combat page

Message_Guide_Dungeon_2.ContentEN: Complete various commissions to earn ascension materials, Coins, Demon Wedges, and all sorts of useful resources.

Message_Guide_Dungeon_4.ContentEN: As Phoxhunters, we're tasked with a diverse array of commissions!

Message_Guide_Dungeon_5.ContentEN: Select <H>Accept the Commission</> to take on the challenge!

Message_Guide_Forge_1.ContentEN: This is the forging bench. The materials we collect can be forged into various weapons and useful items here!

Message_Guide_Forge_2.ContentEN: Before forging, make sure you've got the blueprints and the necessary materials.

Message_Guide_Forge_3.ContentEN: Once you've got everything, use a blueprint and the required materials to kick off the forging process.

Message_Guide_Forge_5.ContentEN: Select here to check the items being forged

Message_Guide_GameEvent_1.ContentEN: Events are now available! Participate in a variety of events to earn exciting rewards.

Message_Guide_GameEvent_2_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <Highlight>Events</> to open the Events page

Message_Guide_GameEvent_2_Phone.ContentEN: Tap <Highlight>Events</> to open the Events page

Message_Guide_Impression_1.ContentEN: Curious about how the rest of Atlasia sees us? Take a gander at the \

Message_Guide_Impression_2.ContentEN: When chatting with people around the world, your <H>choices</> tend to shape the locals' <H>Impressions</> of you.

Message_Guide_Impression_3.ContentEN: Increases in various Impression attributes might bring more intel during interactions or activate side quests, providing support for your adventure.

Message_Guide_Impression_4.ContentEN: <H>Lunoeggy</> admires those with personality. Once you've built up a strong reputation with enough Impression scores, you can challenge <H>Lunoeggy</> in the inner city to a dice game for a chance to win <H>Lunoeggy's Rewards</>!

Message_Guide_ModLevelUp_1.ContentEN: Enhancing the <H>level of Demon Wedges</> can further empower Daimons and weapons.

Message_Guide_ModLevelUp_6.ContentEN: Upgrading Demon Wedges <H>significantly boosts your combat powers</>.

Message_Guide_ModLevelUp_7.ContentEN: Upgrading a Demon Wedge <H>increases its required Tolerance</>. Please make sure the whole required Tolerance <H>do not</> exceed the <H>Tolerance cap</> after the Demon Wedge is upgraded.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_1.ContentEN: A character's innate Track can be adjusted using <H>Track-Shift Modules</>.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_10.ContentEN: If you possess a powerful Demon Wedge but are troubled by an <H>incompatible Track</>, consider <H>adjusting the slot's Track</>.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_11.ContentEN: When a character's slot Track <H>aligns with</> a Demon Wedge's Track, the <H>Tolerance</> required for equipping this Demon Wedge is <H>reduced</>.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_6.ContentEN: You can use <H>Track-Shift Modules</> to add, modify, or eliminate the innate <H>Track</> of a character's Demon Wedge slot.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_7.ContentEN: Frustrated by the limited Tolerance cap preventing more Demon Wedge configurations? Try keeping an eye on <H>Track</>!

Message_Guide_ModTendency_8.ContentEN: Every character or weapon bears intrinsic traits, leading to varied <H>Tracks</> for their <H>Demon Wedge slots</>.

Message_Guide_ModTendency_9.ContentEN: For a more effective use of <H>Demon Wedges</>, some are specifically crafted with a <H>Track</> tailored to certain individuals.

Message_Guide_Mod_1.ContentEN: <H>Demon Wedges</>, crafted by the Spathatoi of Hyperborea, are portable components that significantly enhance the power of Daimons and weapons once equipped.

Message_Guide_Mod_10.ContentEN: Select a Demon Wedge to check its effects

Message_Guide_Mod_11.ContentEN: Consume <H>Coins</> and <H>Carmine Globules</> to <H>upgrade</> Demon Wedges and greatly enhance their powers. However, upgrading Demon Wedges will also increase the burden they put on the bearer, potentially exceeding the Tolerance cap for equipping.

Message_Guide_Mod_12.ContentEN: Here you can quickly toggle between characters and weapons to adjust their Demon Wedges as needed.

Message_Guide_Mod_13.ContentEN: A Character Demon Wedge can be used by multiple characters. Similarly, the same Weapon Demon Wedge can be used on multiple weapons.

Message_Guide_Mod_14.ContentEN: <H>Upgrade</> your characters and weapons to increase their Tolerance caps.

Message_Guide_Mod_3.ContentEN: Demon Wedges come in two types: <H>Character Demon Wedges</> and <H>Weapon Demon Wedges</>, and they are not interchangeable.

Message_Guide_Mod_4.ContentEN: Demon Wedges provide various enhancement effects; they need to be <H>equipped in slots</> to take effect.

Message_Guide_Mod_6.ContentEN: Demon Wedges contain massive powers, thus imposing a certain strain on the bearer.

Message_Guide_Mod_7.ContentEN: The <H>top left corner</> indicates the <H>required Tolerance</> of this Demon Wedge.

Message_Guide_Mod_8.ContentEN: When Tolerance hasn't reached the cap, you can drag a Demon Wedge into an empty slot to equip it.

Message_Guide_Mod_9.ContentEN: <H>Tolerance</> refers to the capacity of characters and weapons to bear Demon Wedges. The number below represents the Tolerance cap of a character or a weapon.

Message_Guide_OpenArmory_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Armoury</> to open the Armoury page

Message_Guide_OpenArmory_Phone.ContentEN: Select <Highlight>Armoury</> to open the Armoury page

Message_Guide_Pet_02.ContentEN: You can attract Geniemons using Treats of varying qualities. The higher the quality, the better your chances of a successful capture.

Message_Guide_Pet_03.ContentEN: Capturing at the right moment increases your chances, especially if you aim for the <H>yellow spot</>.

Message_Guide_Pet_04.ContentEN: Select here to start the capture

Message_Guide_Pet_05.ContentEN: When the time is right, <H>Press</> to throw the Treat.

Message_Guide_Pet_06.ContentEN: Geniemon successfully captured! Head to <H>Armoury</> to check out your new pal.

Message_Guide_Pet_07.ContentEN: Select here to open the <H>Geniemons</> page

Message_Guide_Pet_08.ContentEN: Check the boost to your Resonance provided by the Geniemon here

Message_Guide_Pet_09.ContentEN: View your captured Geniemons and train them here.

Message_Guide_Pet_10.ContentEN: Select here to take the selected Geniemon into battle.

Message_Guide_Pet_11.ContentEN: <H>Press</> &Skill3& to activate Resonance Support in battle.

Message_Guide_Quest_1.ContentEN: If you're not sure what to do next, the <H>Quest Notes</> might give you an idea!

Message_Guide_Quest_2_PC.ContentEN: Hold <H>&ShowCursor&</> to show the cursor, then select <H>Quests</> to view the Quest Notes.

Message_Guide_Quest_3.ContentEN: Quest Notes show details of all ongoing quests. <H>Quest Navigation</> can help us locate quest targets. Remember, some quests may require the completion of prerequisites to continue.

Message_Guide_Quest_5.ContentEN: Select to Navigate or Stop Navigating

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_1.ContentEN: Just now, we've recruited a new companion through Achievements. Now let's bring them into play!

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_3.ContentEN: Select to open the character list

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_6.ContentEN: Select the avatars at the top to quickly switch characters

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_7.ContentEN: Levelling up characters makes them stronger, which consumes a certain amount of <H>Coins</> and <H>Combat Melodies</>.

Message_Guide_ReplaceChar_9.ContentEN: After swapping or levelling up characters, remember to equip them with the appropriate melee and ranged weaponry.

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_1.ContentEN: After completing an Abyssoid Battle or Encounter, you can select <H>1</> of <H>3 Lampwicks</> to enhance your combat abilities during the current abyss exploration.

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_2.ContentEN: Select the <H>Lampwick</> you'd like to receive

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_3.ContentEN: You can use <H>Embers</> to <H>refresh</> the available Lampwick options.

Message_Guide_Rouge3choose1_4.ContentEN: The number of <H>Embers</> you possess is showed here.

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_1.ContentEN: Lighting up the Lantern will enhance its Blessings, boosting your combat abilities during your explosion in Maze of Missteps.

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_3.ContentEN: Select a Blessing node to view the <H>enhancements</> it offers

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_4.ContentEN: Consume a certain amount of <H>Glazeystal</> to light up a Blessing node

Message_Guide_RougeLantern_5.ContentEN: You can toggle between different <H>Lantern Blessings</> here.

Message_Guide_RougeShop_1.ContentEN: At the <H>Mysterious Merchant</>'s stall, you can spend <H>Embers</> to purchase <H>Lampwicks</> and <H>Artefacts</>.

Message_Guide_RougeShop_2.ContentEN: You can toggle between <H>Lampwicks</> and <H>Artefacts</> here.

Message_Guide_Rouge_1.ContentEN: <H>Maze of Missteps</> is now open. Dive into the unknown abyss, empower yourself with various combinations of Lampwicks and Artefacts, and confront formidable foes.

Message_Guide_Rouge_5.ContentEN: You can adjust the difficulty settings here.

Message_Guide_Rouge_6.ContentEN: You can view and claim your rewards here. Rewards refresh weekly.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_1.ContentEN: Sandrealm Meditation lets you revisit and battle past enemies in a controlled environment, helping you familiarise yourself with their moves and hone your combat skills.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_3.ContentEN: Select <H>+</> to increase the <H>number of enemies</> spawned

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_4.ContentEN: If <H>multiple enemies</> are selected, you can adjust their respective spawn numbers here.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_5.ContentEN: Select <H>+</> to raise the <H>level of the enemy</>

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_6.ContentEN: You can choose whether to enable the <H>invincibility mode</> here.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_7.ContentEN: You can choose whether to activate <H>Enemy Active Mode</>. If turned off, enemies will neither move nor attack.

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_PC.ContentEN: Press &TrainingOpenSetup& to open the Meditation menu

Message_Guide_TrainingGround_Phone.ContentEN: Tap the interact button to open the Meditation Menu

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_1.ContentEN: When dealing damage with a weapon, there's a chance to trigger physical <H>Bonus Effect</>. The chance is based on the weapon's <H>Trigger Probability</>.

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_2.ContentEN: Different attributes have different <H>bonus effects</>, which can be viewed in <H>Attribute Info</>.

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_3.ContentEN: <H>Characters</> contribute to elemental attacks that may trigger elemental Bonus Effects— <H>Hydro, Pyro, Anemo, Electro, Lumino, and Umbro</>. Each elemental <H>Bonus Effect</> inflicts corresponding <H>periodic damage</> on the target.

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_4.ContentEN: <H>Weapons</> contribute to the physical attacks that may trigger physical Bonus Effects — <H>Slash, Spike, and Smash</>. Each physical <H>Bonus Effect</> provides corresponding damage boost or improves the effectiveness of weakening the target's Stance.

Message_Guide_WeaponTrigger_5.ContentEN: When dealing damage with a weapon, there's a chance to trigger physical <H>Bonus Effect</>. The chance is based on the weapon's <H>Trigger Probability</>.

ModGuideQuest_Des_1_2.ContentEN: Enhance 5 different Demon Wedges to Lv. 3

ModGuideQuest_Des_2_2.ContentEN: Enhance 10 different Demon Wedges to Lv. 3

ModGuideQuest_Des_2_3.ContentEN: Equip any character with a Lv. 3 Green-tier Demon Wedge or one of higher tier

ModGuideQuest_Des_3_1.ContentEN: Collect 5 Green-tier or better Demon Wedges

ModGuideQuest_Des_3_2.ContentEN: Enhance 5 different Green-tier or better Demon Wedges to Lv. 3

ModGuideQuest_Des_3_3.ContentEN: Equip any character with a Lv. 5 Blue-tier Demon Wedge or one of higher tier

ModGuideQuest_Title.ContentEN:
Lunosmith's Demon Wedge 101 %s\
Complete the tutorials to earn Trial EXP and Phoxene

Mod_Sell_Tip.ContentEN: The Demon Wedge is currently equipped. Are you sure you want to sell it?

Mod_Upgrade_Tip.ContentEN: # does not meet the Tolerance requirements. Are you sure you want to remove the Demon Wedge from #?
